answers.answer: Hello,Diabetes mellitus is one of the common causes of weight loss and may present with symptoms like increased urination, increased appetite, weight loss etc. A number of other conditions like inflammatory bowel disease, peptic ulcer disease, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis , celiac disease, hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism, diabetes, adrenal insufficiency, congestive heart failure, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, cancer, infections, taking over-the-counter medications or prescription medications, neurological illnesses, kidney diseases can lead to weight loss. Any malignancy or cancer in the body can also lead to weight loss. All these conditions will have associated symptoms that may provide a clue to the diagnosis. Hope it helps.Take care and best luck!
